conclusion: Analyze the image to understand the setup of the parallel-plate capacitor and the point charge.

The image shows a parallel-plate capacitor with a positive charge on the left plate and a negative charge on the right plate. The distance between the plates is labeled as \( d \). A point charge \( q \) is placed at the midpoint between the two plates.
The capacitance of the parallel-plate capacitor is given as \( C \).
The charge on the capacitor is \( Q \).
The distance between the plates is \( d \).
The point charge \( q \) is placed at the midpoint between the two plates.
The magnitude of the electrostatic force experienced by the point charge \( q \) can be calculated using Coulomb's law.
The force on the point charge due to the capacitor plates is given by \( F = \frac{1}{2} \frac{Q^2}{C} \).
This formula accounts for the force experienced by the point charge due to the electric field generated by the capacitor plates.
Therefore, the magnitude of the electrostatic force experienced by the point charge \( q \) is \( \frac{1}{2} \frac{Q^2}{C} \).
